My ‘Beyond the Book’ Bingo

The final challenge in our ‘Beyond the Book’ activity booklet is book bingo. Each of the 25 bingo squares represents a different genre of book from ‘something that scares you’ and a ‘book with a blue cover’, to ‘a book recommended by a friend‘ and one ‘with non-human characters’. Hopefully this will introduce pupils to new genres and styles and encourage them to browse library shelves.

I am playing along and will update the list below with the books I read throughout the year. I am also asking for pupils to recommend books for me during my ‘Beyond the Book’ assemblies – on the 11 January 2016, year 7 pupil Rachel from Ipswich Academy recommended Charlotte’s Web by E.B. White for my ‘with non-human characters’ square!

It would be really powerful for teachers to play book bingo and to display their bingo sheets in classrooms.

If you would like to get involved you can print off the Beyond the Book Bingo sheet and play along. Don’t forget to tweet us your bingo reads to @SuffolkLibrary using #beyondthebook as you cross them off!

My ‘Beyond the Book’ Bingo list (updated 01/03/2016)

Less than 100 pages: 4/1/2016 – Hilda and the Troll by Luke Pearson

By a male author: 11/01/2016 Jekyll’s Mirror by William Hussey

That scares you: 1/1/2016 – Coraline by Neil Gaiman (truly terrifying characters with buttons for eyes!)

With non-human characters: 26/1/2016 – Charlotte’s Web by E.B. White (recommended to me by a pupil at Ipswich Academy)

Short stories:

Award winning book: 14/1/2016 –  Mortal Engines by Philip Reeve

The 2nd book in a series:

With a one word title:

Set on a different continent: 21/1/2016 – The Double Axe by Philip Womack

Funny book:

A graphic novel: 22/02/2016 – - Stormbreaker by Anthony Horrowitz

Book published in the year you were born:

FREE CHOICE:

By a female author:

With illustrations:

With a blue cover:

Book of poetry: Billionaire Boy by David Walliams (recommended to me by a pupil at Pakefield High)

A best-selling book: Diary of a Wimpy Kid by Jeff Kinney (recommended to me by a pupil at Stowupland High)

Book published this year: 17/01/2016 – More of Me by Katheryn Evans

Book someone in your family read as a child:

By a former Children’s Laureate: 01/02/2016 – The Door that led to where by Sally Gardner

Book that became a film: 18/01/2016** Howl’s Moving Castle by Diana Wynne Jones

Book recommended by a friend:

A non-fiction book: 06/02/2016 – Mind Your Head by Juno Dawson

About

My name is Matt Shenton and I am working for Suffolk Libraries as a dedicated ‘Literacy Ambassador’ for the next year. My role is to work with schools, statutory and voluntary organisations and other interested parties to promote reading for pleasure and the importance of literacy to young people and their families in Suffolk.
